Articles.Content:
Calling 911 to enroll yourself as a policeman

Edited September 2, 2022 by Aerodynamic Kerbal
New page
Calling 911 because you were catfished by an atari game

Calling 911 because the Darkness Portal is opened in your wardrobe...

Spoiler

... when you were promised that it will be in the bathtub.
Calling 911 because you don't know if you can port your game assets from Build engine to Unity.
Calling 911 for thinking you got mad from seeing that somebody is still using the DOS4GW Build engine from 1990s.

Calling 911 because I have to develop my game for a console that doesn't support the game's engine.

("You mean like when BigRedButton had to put their Cryengine 3 game on the Wii U? Tragically, no emergency services can save you, your game, or your developer. But we are very sorry because we understand your pain.")
Calling 911 for a parallax glitch
Calling 911 to check the phone connection.
Calling 911 because you thought the iPhone 14's emergency satellite connection feature was cool and just had to test it out.
Calling 911 to test your brand new Starlink Antenna
Calling 911 to say, "This is a test of the emergency broadcast system. This is only a test."
Calling 911 and enabling a metronome.
Calling 911 because you are not in the USA and want to see what happens.
Calling 911 because I am not in the USA and have seen on TV what happens.

(How about an old reference?)

Calling 911 to say, "It looks like you're directing an Ambulance. Would you like help?"
Calling 911 because KSP is frozen.
Calling 911 how you just had called them.
Calling 911 because my computer was gone for repairs.

(I killed it, but I guess it's time to resurrect it.)

From E-Comm's 2022 list of top 10 nuisance calls:

Calling 911 because...

....you had a broken windshield wiper.

...someone cut in line at the car wash.

...you wanted an update on a nationwide telco outage.

...your phone was stuck in a bench.

...you had a complaint about children drawing with chalk at a playground.

...someone has been using your garbage bin.

...someone isn't picking up after their dog.

...people are playing basketball on a public court at night.

...you have a flat tire.

...the nozzle of the gas station pump isn't working.

(And honorable mention)

...you have a messy roommate.

Edited January 4, 2023 by 55delta
minor correction

911: 911 What’s your emergency?

Caller: Yes people are mispronouncing the word gif. They are insisting it is pronounced like the peanut butter Jif.

911: I see sir. Please seek a safe place to shelter. I am dispatching SWAT, National Guard, local police and the Sheriffs department. Rest assured those individuals who are saying “jif” instead of gif (think g from gator or gorilla or garage) will be taken into custody.

Caller: Thank you! Please hurry!

230001042023

8 hours ago, AlamoVampire said:

911: 911 What’s your emergency?

Caller: Yes people are mispronouncing the word gif. They are insisting it is pronounced like the peanut butter Jif.

911: I see sir. Please seek a safe place to shelter. I am dispatching SWAT, National Guard, local police and the Sheriffs department. Rest assured those individuals who are saying “jif” instead of gif (think g from gator or gorilla or garage) will be taken into custody.

Caller: Thank you! Please hurry!

230001042023

It's actually pronounced "jif" in my country.

9 hours ago, AlamoVampire said:

garage

Which g bruh, answer right now or i'm calling 911 to find it out 

Spoiler

Of course not IRL, just a creative take on the game

2 hours ago, Nazalassa said:

It's actually pronounced "jif" in my country.

Ja, ja, jefe.
Calling 911 on accident because you accidentally butt-dialed them.
Calling 911 because the car in the McDonald's drive-thru queue in front of you is taking too long to order!
